Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Located on A34 (Kingsway), close to the M60

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Free On Street Car Parking Spaces

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Unique turn key office opportunity located in a thriving business district. The space includes excellent quality existing fit out incorporating glazed
meeting rooms and kitchen/ break out area. The space is also fully furnished and has existing cabling in place meaning you could move in with no initial fit out costs.

Located in the heart of Altrincham Town Centre, Vertex is an impressive Grade A contemporary HQ office building currently being transformed to provide creative functional space for modern working. Vertex is immersed in the heart of one of Cheshire’s most vibrant towns within 300 metres of the nationally acclaimed Altrincham market with all its associated benefits.

A Grade II-listed building located in stunning parkland in Cheadle Village, Abney Hall provides a setting for an office with a difference. It is perfect for companies looking for contemporary workspace with individual character. With suites available on flexible leases for four people up to 24, there are a variety of options available to your business for immediate requirements and in the long term as your business grows. Abney Hall is a collection of characterful small suites in Cheadle. Rooms in the historic building all come with their own unique features from period fireplaces, wood panelling to stain glass windows. A grand main entrance makes a statement for staff and visitors arriving at the hall: the front door gives way to an ornately tiled hallway and carved wooden staircase. Set within the grounds of Abney Park, Abney Hall is just a few minutes’ walk away from Cheadle village. The village centre offers a wide choice of restaurants, bars, cafes and supermarkets. The popular retail destination at Cheadle Royal, which includes a John Lewis and Sainsbury’s, is just a 5 minute drive away. Abney Hall benefits from on-site parking and has convenient access to both the M60 and M56. The East Didsbury transport interchange for bus, rail and Metrolink connections is a 15 minute walk away.

Located within 1 mile of junction 3 of the M56 and junction 5 of the M60 motorways, Southmoor Industrial Estate is located around three miles from Manchester Airport and is on a regular public transport route.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Of Approximately 10,850 sq ft Open Plan
Two 13 Person High Speed Passenger Lifts Lifts

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Stockport Exchange is the redevelopment of the former Grand Central, Stockport. The scheme is located within Stockport Town Centre, directly next to Stockport Railway Station. The buildings therefore benefit from the amenities of Stockport Town Centre, Merseyway Shopping Centre is within 3-4 minutes’ walk away and offers an array of shops, bars and restaurants. Stockport Station is on the main railway line to London and offers direct trains from Stockport to London in 2 hours. Manchester City Centre is 10 minutes on a train, accessible by bus or alternatively is 15 minute drive away. Junction 1 of M60 is within a couple of minutes’ drive. Phase 1 is now complete and provides a 1000 space NCP car park. Phase 1, consists of a 115 bed hotel and public realm and a 48,000 sq ft office building which is now fully let to Stagecoach and Music Magpie.
The Lodge is part of Towers business community and benefits from the amenities, and on site activities.

The Pavilion Towers Business Park is perfectly located within walking distance of Didsbury town centre. Towers is situated just off the A34, six miles from Manchester City Centre and International Airport. East Didsbury railway station and the new East Didsbury Metrolink are within a  four minute walk. Kingston is a Grade A specification self-contained office building offering ground floor open plan accommodation accessed via a contemporary modern entrance.

Adamson House Towers Business Park is perfectly located within walking distance of Didsbury Town centre. Towers is situated just off the A34, six miles from Manchester City Centre and International Airport. East Didsbury railway station and the new East Didsbury Metrolink are within a four minute walk. The part 2nd floor suite of 7,480 sq ft is fully fitted out to a high standard including a reception, two private offices, two meeting rooms and a kitchen facility.

STOK will be light, bright and inviting. Easily reached and located in the heart of town, it's a workspace people will love. STOK’S location puts you within a short walk from a wide array of shops, eateries, cafés and bars. The historic Market and Underbank Areas are perfect for those who love to browse alternative independents, and all-told there are 23 pubs and 19 restaurants, all on the doorstep.

Towers is perfectly located within walking distance of Didsbury town centre. Towers is situated just off the A34, six miles from Manchester City Centre and International Airport. East Didsbury railway station and the new East Didsbury Metrolink are within a  four minute walk. Worthington is a Grade A specification self-contained office building offering ground floor open plan accommodation accessed via a contemporary modern entrance.

Metro is a prominent office building that provides efficient, environmentally friendly, flexible offices to satisfy the most discerning occupier. The last remaining suite is located on the first floor which has a flexible open plan floorplate. Metro has many energy reducing features meaning an occupier of the building will make significant cost savings over the term of their lease. Metro was awarded a Post Construction BREEAM ‘Excellent’ rating. Metro occupies a highly prominent position at the entrance to Salford Quays, on the doorstep to MediaCityUK. The building is also adjacent to the metrolink stop. Business or pleasure, the perfect location Salford Quays is now home to a thriving commercial centre employing BBC staff at
MediaCityUK which is a clear endorsement of the benefits of Salford Quays as an office location and brings with it additional infrastructure and retail/leisure enhancements.

The Tootal Buildings are located within the vibrant and exciting neighbourhood of Manchester’s Oxford Road corridor in central Manchester. Together, they form two iconic Grade II listed inter-linked office buildings in this well-established neighbourhood which boasts some of Manchester’s best bars and restaurants as well as fantastic public transport links and easy access to all of the city’s renowned retail and leisure amenities. The buildings offer nearly 250,000 sq ft of offices and have a central open air courtyard where a range of events take place throughout the year. The Tootal Buildings are in a prominent, central location, that’s convenient for both lunchtimes and evening socialising. There are bars, newsagents, supermarkets and coffee shops right on the doorstep. Oxford Road offers ready access to all of the city’s retail and leisure amenities and public transport; Oxford Road Train Station is literally at the end of the street. Metrolink trams and major bus routes are found right around the corner and Manchester’s mainline Piccadilly Train Station is a short walk away. The buildings occupy a strategic location at the gateway to the “Oxford Road Corridor”, well known for the rapid growth of technology and education-based sectors. The University of Manchester, Manchester Metropolitan University and the Royal Northern College of Music are grouped around Oxford Road on the southern side of the city center. In context, Manchester’s economy benefits from having one of the highest graduate retention rates in the UK. Optical fibre broadband has recently been installed along Oxford Road, which provides ultra-fast broadband speeds to the buildings.

The Tootal Buildings are located within the vibrant and exciting neighbourhood of Manchester’s Oxford Road corridor in central Manchester. Together, they form two iconic Grade II listed inter-linked office buildings in this well-established neighbourhood which boasts some of Manchester’s best bars and restaurants as well as fantastic public transport links and easy access to all of the city’s renowned retail and leisure amenities. The buildings offer nearly 250,000 sq ft of offices and have a central open air courtyard where a range of events take place throughout the year. The Tootal Buildings are in a prominent, central location, that’s convenient for both lunchtimes and evening socialising. There are bars, newsagents, supermarkets and coffee shops right on the doorstep. Oxford Road offers ready access to all of the city’s retail and leisure amenities and public transport; Oxford Road Train Station is literally at the end of the street. Metrolink trams and major bus routes are found right around the corner and Manchester’s mainline Piccadilly Train Station is a short walk away. The buildings occupy a strategic location at the gateway to the “Oxford Road Corridor”, well known for the rapid growth of technology and education-based sectors. The University of Manchester, Manchester Metropolitan University and the Royal Northern College of Music are grouped around Oxford Road on the southern side of the city center. In context, Manchester’s economy benefits from having one of the highest graduate retention rates in the UK. Optical fibre broadband has recently been installed along Oxford Road, which provides ultra-fast broadband speeds to the buildings.

Heralded as Manchester's greenest office building, Windmill Green is the city's first BREEAM Outstanding building with a WiredScore Platinum status. But the building offers more than credentials. With a private Brompton bike hire, it has also been dubbed Manchester's most cycle-friendly building by CycleScore — and a rooftop terrace (with two active beehives, to boot) offers a beautiful bird’s-eye view of Manchester’s City Centre. Outside Windmill Green, you’ll find Town Hall, the Manchester Art Gallery and the Central Convention Complex all a stone’s throw away. St Peter’s Square Tram is across the street — and the Albert Square transit hub and Deansgate Station are close by, too. Inside, Hana offers three floors of private offices, meeting rooms, phone booths and focus rooms — all fully serviced and ready for professionals and teams who expect more from where they work.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Double height feature reception space Reception

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 29 Peter Street offers high quality remodelled office accommodation with the benefit of on-site car parking in a highly sought-after business district. High ceilings revealing exposed services give the suites a contemporary and modern feel and provide a perfect work space for all of today’s business needs. With a host of amenities and the city’s Metrolink transport system on the doorstep, 29 Peter Street provides the ideal office location. The building occupies an excellent and central location within Manchester City Centre opposite to the 5 Star Radisson Blu Edwardian Hotel. The city’s conference centre is a 3 minute walk away at the Manchester Central Plaza. 29 Peter Street is ideally situated with quick and easy access to St Peter’s Square Metrolink Station, Oxford Road, Deansgate and Salford Central Railway stations and the Greater Manchester public transport system. An enviable range of amenities to including Great Northern Warehouse Leisure complex, Albert Schloss and Revolution de Cuba are all within a 5 minute walk and Rudy’s Neopolitan Pizza is right on the doorstep on the ground floor of the building. Peter Street is part of an ever evolving business, conference and leisure hub with Manchester City Council having implemented a multi-million pound development programme around St Peter’s Square to make it a popular choice for office occupiers. An influx of new bars, restaurants and coffee bars and has added to the cosmopolitan nature of the immediate area.

Corner Block is a self-contained, newly refurbished office building located on the corner of Deansgate and Quay Street in the very heart of Manchester city centre.  It offers flexible, efficient office space for forward thinking, creative occupiers.  Corner Block benefits from a fantastic feature reception, a new air conditioning system, LED lighting, an exposed soffit ceiling, lifts, showers and cycling facilities.  The building can accommodate requirements from 3,200 sq ft to 55,000 sq ft. Quoting rents from from £24.00 to £27.00 per sq ft.

Transport links are just a short walk away, including St Peter’s Square Metrolink tram station while Manchester Victoria and Deansgate train stations are also within a short walking distance.

80 Mosley offers boutique style suites for well-established and growing businesses with flexibility to suit. The contemporary refurbished double-height reception provides an impressive and welcoming sense of arrival. The elegant polished concrete floor tiles and glazed brick detail provides a sense of premium and modern design that is consistent throughout all the newly refurbished common areas. Sweeping glazing provides 80 Mosley Street’s refurbished floorplates with an abundance of natural light coupled with the unobstructed views across St. Peter’s Square which are amongst the city’s most spectacular. The building’s floorplates allow efficiency and flexibility that can be customised with ease to reflect your company’s identity and brand. Small floorplates allow unique self-contained occupancy to tenants. Manchester has undergone an astonishing evolution in recent years, and the city centre’s ever-kinetic business district is a testament to that. At the epicentre of this bustling engine-room sits 80 Mosley Street. The floors look out onto iconic St. Peter’s Square, home to no less than four Grade I or II listed structures: Manchester Central Library, the Midland Hotel, Manchester Cenotaph and Manchester Town Hall. City centre views don’t come much grander. If any single location can lay claim to being the beating heart of Manchester, St. Peter’s Square is it.

The St James’s Tower podium floors are modern, clean lined and flooded with natural light. Expansive enough for a business requiring a sizeable amount of space, and also flexible enough, to be comfortably sub-divided into two or three standalone units. The refurbishment comprises the construction of a two storey full height structural glazed extension to the front elevation of St James’s Tower. St James’s Tower sits at the epicentre of Manchester’s central business district, surrounded by any and every amenity imaginable. Piccadilly Gardens’ Metrolink station is 60 seconds walk from your door, swiftly connecting to 93 locations throughout Greater Manchester. Meanwhile, Manchester Piccadilly mainline station is but a 5 minute stroll away.

An impressive 1800s warehouse redesigned as an inspiring workspace for modern industry, creative entrepreneurs and innovators. Located in the heart of Enterprise City, Manchester’s tech hub, Bonded Warehouse is an iconic destination for work, wellness and social experiences. The workspace offers hot desks, resident desks, premium office suites, dedicated office floors, breakout areas, event spaces and meeting room facilities; all stunningly designed to retain original heritage features including exposed brick walls and large windows. Business essentials come as standard including a stylish kitchen, tea & coffee, 24/7 access, on-site tech support, soundproofed phone booths, WiFi and a community management team. A work life balance is encouraged with an on-site gym, bike storage, shower facilities, breakout areas, coffee shop and a members’ Clubhouse with a brasserie menu and bar.

11 floors of contemporary office space. Located on Deansgate, within touching distance of Spinningfields and Albert Square, Centurion House offers your business proximity to the city’s commercial hub. The building has been refurbished to a high standard and an on-site Starbucks coffee shop and welcoming reception area contribute to a great arrival experience. On the ground floor high quality meeting rooms and conference facilities are available at a reduced rate for our customers to hire. On the third floor you’ll find a customer lounge giving you and your staff space to collaborate or enjoy lunch away from your desk. The upper floors benefit from stunning views across the city and beyond, and the location of Centurion House means that your business will have a strong presence in a prestigious location. With a wide selection of bar, cafés, shops, gyms and restaurants right on the doorstep and a selection of transports links within walking distance, Centurion House is the perfect home for any business.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Suspended Incorporating Metal Perforated Tiled Ceiling
Semi-recessed LG7 Incorporating T5 Lamp Technology Lighting

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Inside and out, Chancery Place is designed to wow. Gazing up at the building from street level, those soaring, curved glass elevations provide plenty of prestige and drama. From within, the full-height glazing allows for sweeping panoramic views across the city. The extensive glazing also allows you to utilise every inch of your floor space, offering a beautiful blank canvas onto which to project your company’s personality. To get Grade A office space of this quality in a competing building, you’d likely need to share a floor with another business. Chancery Place’s floorplate sizes, however, allow you to make an entire floor your own. Floors can also be split from 2,500 sq ft, meaning the prestige can be enjoyed by companies of all sizes.

Clarence House is an endearing 19th Century building that fuses classical elegance with exclusive and contemporary office space. Following completion of a comprehensive refurbishment, Clarence House provides exemplary office space. Arranged over ground and five upper floors, the building benefits from an impressive remodelled entrance. The elegant facade has been enhanced by new windows and sensitive restoration. Clarence House is located on the corner of Clarence Street and Tib Lane within the Albert Square conservation area. This is a unique position at the heart of Manchester’s traditional prime core. It is home to many major corporate occupiers and is supported by high quality restaurants, bars and retail. The building is within close proximity of two Metrolink stations (St Peter’s Square and Mosley Street) and national and local railway stations (Piccadilly and Victoria).

In the heart of Spinningfields, it’s everything you and your business need under one roof. This contemporary workspace is designed to inspire productivity and support members’ work life balance with flexible office space and on-site wellness amenities. The impressive space offers hot desks, resident desks, premium office suites, dedicated office floors, breakout areas, event spaces and meeting room facilities; all designed by leading property designers. Business essentials come as standard including a stylish kitchen, tea & coffee, 24/7 access, on-site tech support, soundproofed phone booths, WiFi and a community management team. Given the importance of wellness in enhancing productivity, the space also offers bike parking, exclusive yoga classes, member events and an on-site coffee shop, bar and restaurant.

Located in the increasingly sought after Norther Quarter on Hilton Street Fourways house is a Grade II listed brick built building constructed in 1906. The property has since been converted to provide character office accommodation arranged over ground and five upper floors providing a total of 59,000 sq ft. Finished to a high standard and retaining it's character features including exposed brick walls, timber floors, steel columns and exposed ceilings. Suites available from 1,000 sq ft – 15,000 sq ft.

The Ironworks is an attractive period building providing excellent office suites arranged over three upper floors. The building has undergone an extensive refurbishment programme and is accessed via an impressive feature entrance leading up to the office suites via a newly carpeted and decorated stair well. The refurbishment provides a contemporary boutique feel with high quality office specification throughout. The property is situated in a prime location within Manchester city centre on South King Street which runs parallel to the pedestrianised area of King Street, Manchester’s most prestigious business address. Located in the city’s vibrant commercial core are a wide range of high calibre retailers and leisure operators which combine to offer a variety of amenities adding the appeal of this highly desirable location which is home to Jamie’s Italian, Browns, Rosso, All Bar One, El Gato Negro, Pretty Green, DKNY, Sharps, The White Company and Diesel to name a few.

23 King Street is located on the popular pedestrianised section of the street above The White Company. The building offers accommodation over 3 upper floors, with the available office space located on the 1st & 3rd floors. The 1st floor (rear) suite extends to 457 sq ft and spans 2 rooms which are connected by an interlinking door. The 3rd floor (front) suite is an open plan layout extending 396 sq ft and being at the top of the building benefits from excellent natural light. Both suites have access to a shared kitchen facility on the 2nd floor. The offices may be suitable for D1 (Medical) usage, subject to planning consent, and may also qualify for small business rates relief. There are numerous retailers and leisure operators within minutes walk, including Jamie’s Italian, Browns, Rosso, All Bar One, El Gato Negro, Pretty Green, DKNY, and Diesel to name a few. King street enjoys convenient access to Manchester’s comprehensive transport network including Piccadilly, Oxford Road, Victoria and Deansgate Railway Stations, as well as being within a short walk of St Peter’s Square Metrolink Station. Local NCP car parking is also within close proximity to King Street.

28/30 King Street is an impressive Grade II listed character building situated in the heart of Manchester’s premium pedestrianised retail hub. The accommodation offers occupiers excellent views down King Street and is on the doorstep of all amenities and public transport links. It can accommodate occupiers seeking 400 sq ft up to 1,500 sq ft.

10 Chapel Walks is undergoing a major remodelling to deliver a vibrant and engaging business destination providing a newly refurbished building reception area and efficient open plan workspace. The refurbished property will be aimed to suit the evolved needs of the modern occupiers from all sectors wanting be located in Manchester’s Central Business District. Standing proudly on Cross Street facing St Ann’s Street with frontages to Cheapside and Chapel Walks, the building enjoys prominence in the heart of Manchester surrounded by all the amenity this vibrant cosmopolitan city centre has to offer. Quoting rents from £23.00 psf to £27.50 per sq ft.

Centenary House is a high specification four storey office building on the edge of MediaCityUK, Trafford Park, Eccles. The building offers a very accessible location with both close proximity to the M602/M60 and extensive undercroft and surface car parking. A true landmark headquarters style building with an architecturally striking design and a grade A specification. Centenary House is prominently positioned fronting Centenary Way within 1 mile of junction 2 of the M602 motorway which provides direct access to the regional motorway network. The property benefits from its close proximity to Eccles town centre, a short walk to the west. The building is well placed to take advantage of Eccles Metrolink Station and Bus Interchange offering direct routes into Manchester city centre.

Rhodes Business Park is situated on Manchester Old Road and consists of a mixture of high quality office accommodation and modern industrial units. The building comprises two storey offices located at front of the business park and within easy access to junction 19 M60 Orbital motorway providing access to M62, M61 and M6 and also Middleton town centre.
